headline: Italian Turkey Meatballs
description: Italian-style turkey meatballs are lean and clean with fresh herbs, Parmesan cheese, and seasoned bread crumbs. Try them on pasta or in a meatball sub!
name: Italian Turkey Meatballs
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons Melt® Organic Buttery Spread, softened

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease a broiler pan with buttery spread.

Mix ground turkey, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan, tomato sauce, garlic, oregano, rosemary, mustard, cayenne, and salt together in a large bowl until well combined. Form mixture into 30 meatballs; place onto the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink inside, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent recipe as written.
Used less breadcrumbs added an egg. Suoer friggen good.

Fantastic. Made as directed except used dried oregano and looked up the conversion for fresh to dried. Also, no idea what Melt is. Used parchment paper and the meatballs came right off after baking. Slight crust on the outside and tender on the inside. Perfect!

I used 3/4 cup panco crumbs, my own mix of italian herbs and mozzarella instead of parmesan, 3 cloves of fresh crushed garlic and 2 eggs with 1 lb ground turkey. Served on a plate of fettuccine with a drizzle of garlic butter and handful of more shredded mozzarella as I'm allergic to tomatoes.

These are excellent! These are my substitutions and comments: I made mine with a pound and a half ground chicken. Before putting them in the oven, I rolled my meatballs around in about 2 teaspoons garlic infused olive oil that I had placed in the bottom of my stoneware. That gave them a nice glisten. They cooked well in my stoneware at 400° for 20 minutes.
these sound like they'd be good for WW turkey meatball soup. delicious and lower calories with chicken or veggie broth. thank you, enjoyed the reviews, will make soon.

I love this recipe; the meatballs turned out very moist and tasty. In fact, I don't miss the beef or pork at all; I prefer these. I followed the recipe with the exception of substituting dried herbs for fresh, as I didn't have any fresh on hand. I also added a little bit more red pepper flakes.
These are AMAZING!!!! I added cooked quinoa instead of rice, handful of fresh cilantro, and tomato paste instead..... delicious and our new favorite way to make meatballs.

I make these often. I usually use dried herbs since I don’t often have fresh. Also I use regular bread crumbs instead of Italian seasoned and just add a little Italian seasoning to the mixture. Using parchment paper on my baking sheet makes clean up a breeze. I use a small scoop for my meatballs so I get several more and don’t bake them as long. Probably about 10 minutes.
These meatballs are so tender and delicious that I use them and everything. They are good with spaghetti or as the main meat dish with anything else you want to fix. My go to!?
So yummy, but for health reasons I left off the buttery spread. Still so yummy.
These were very tasty with a nice flavor. The recipe can easily be adjusted to ones own taste.

This recipe was so easy ! I’m Italian and these were banging I used dry spices , added some onion powder and fresh grated cheese . Used Pam spray instead of the suggested butter . Definitely a keeper and when I make my sauce I’ll drop some in and nobody will know , even though my family eats pretty much everything!!

Awesome! I made these gluten-free by using gluten-free bread crumbs. I also used dried herbs instead of fresh since that's all I had on hand (used another reviewer's adjustment of 1 Tbsp fresh = 1 tsp dried). After cooking, I transferred them into my slow cooker with a few jars of heated sauce and let them simmer for an hour before serving. Meatballs were just the right consistency - not too hard and not too soft. This recipe is definitely a keeper
OMG!! These meatballs are yummy with or without sauce.

I cooked this meal with using the ingredients I had available and it came out delicious. My modified version of this recipe is my favorite. I used the following:
Groundbeef
Parmesan Cheese
Spaghetti Sauce (Pick Your Favorite)
Salt/Pepper
Minced Garlic
Butter

I really liked this recipe a lot! I made the meatballs exactly as the recipe was written with fresh herbs from my new "pandemic" herb garden. Then, I fried up some Polenta from Trader Joe's to serve the meatballs on and topped it with RAO'S Marinara sauce and a sprig of basil and more Parmesan cheese. This tasted like something I would serve to company. Super good. I'll be making this again!!! Tip - I just put the meatballs on a non-stick pan from Sur La Table, and they stuck to the bottom. Next time I will add a non-stick spray or EVOO.

We love these! My picky son loves them too. Did not change the recipe. I did, in effort to speed up dinner cooking time out these in my Instant Pot with a jar of pre-made sauce and they were so good. I put in the sauce and then nestled the meatballs on top and had to layer a few. Only issue is they burned a little. Think I should have e added more liquid. Still learning how to use the Instant Pot.

I changed some items around as I was missing parsley and crushed red peppers so substituted those ingredients and used chopped red peppers instead.

Next time will try it the original way of making it.
Made as directed, used olive oil, instead of melt. A bit dry.
Easy to make, and great tasting. Ground turkey generally isn't the most flavourful, I cut back on a few of the spices and red pepper and found it was indeed missing a certain something.
This is one of my go to recipes! I’ve made it countless times and it always comes out perfect.
I only had one pound of meat, so the amounts were a bit smaller for the other ingredients. I also substituted the bread crumbs for panko. Overall, it turned out great!
I made the Italian meatballs and added them to a spaghetti sauce and had spaghetti and meatballs and they were delicious.

Turned out really nice! I modified for a 1 pound package and substituted dry spices as that's all I have right now. But very happy with how it turned out. In the future, I would use as much tomato sauce as the original recipe, as I think my modification made them a bit dry. Very yummy!
Used dried herbs, but still turned out really great!
These were great!
Left off mustard, used dried spices as I didn’t have fresh, and used a bit more cheese. Very tasty!

These were so good. I wanted to use what I had at home and only had 1 pound of turkey Italian sausage so I used that and adjusted the other ingredients, just sort of eyeballed it but it came out fine. I also didn’t have fresh herbs but used Italian spice blend and it was very tasty. I’d make these again in a heartbeat but would probably try it with the actual ingredients as listed. I like that it didn’t have an egg in it. The texture was great. They meatball were a hit. I served them with sautéed onion and green pepper cooked with diced Italian tomatoes. Super yummy!
placed half cooked meatballs in gravy to cook the rest of the way.

Went down well with the kids. Made them small sized. Substatuted a few things. Two tea spoons dried origanao and djone mustard. Missed Che red Pepper out as the kids don't like spicy food. Still worked well and a good firm texture. Will be making again
I followed the directions as written, and these are SO delicious! I found italian ground turkey, but still added all the ingredients. Used my air fryer and YUM!!!
I made mine using 5 lbs. of ground turkey. I added a cup of fresh, chopped basil and substituted cayenne for the red pepper flakes. Sooo tasty.

So delicious!! I only used a pound of ground turkey so I adjusted amounts slightly. Very flavorful. I’ve never used sauce in my meatballs, always did egg, but these went together (and stayed together) perfectly with the sauce as the only wet ingredient. Made them night before and while I usually let things cool a little while before putting in fridge, I had to put these away warm so I didn’t keep eating them. Hahaha

These were delicious!! Followed the recipe but cooked them in an air fryer at 380 for about 15-20 mins and they came out great. I didn’t use butter but I sprayed the air fryer with a coat of olive oil. My very picky 3 yr old even loved them!
YUM! These are delicious! Very impressed!
Great recipe. Have used more than once. Absolutely great tasting. Now use all the time

This is a godsend. A family member had a quadruple bypass and needed to change his eating habits. I made the recipe as written only leaving out the cheese and substituting 1 tablespoon of olive oil for the melt.

He liked them served over spaghetti, and as left overs as a meat ball sandwich when a quick meal was needed. I am going to use the meatballs instead of pepperoni in a low fat pizza. A reviewer said this tastes like Italian sausage which is a great substitute.
Was great. A little too much rosemary but family loves it
I also mixed in other vegetables. Came out great.
“These are actually really good”. Words of my two
My wife is hard to please and she said that they were the best meatballs she ever had! I’m Italian and I agree. Great recipe! I just used dry spices and i used olive oil in the bottom of
big hit in my house - my picky eater had 10!
Very tasty!
I made them larger and marinated them with pasta sauce. They turned out amazing!

I have tried several recipes from other sites and this one beats them by far. Having to work from what I already had; I substituted Italian seasoned diced tomatoes instead of sauce, I didn't use Oregano and I only used 1 lb. of ground turkey, and I added 1/4 tsp. of onion powder. I would definitely make this again and again. YUM!!

These meatballs turned out juicy, flavorful, and fantastic. I did make a couple minor changes. I used grated Parmesan, seasoned breadcrumbs, and since I didn't feel like buying fresh herbs since someone them would have gone to waste, I used tomato sauce that had basil and oregano added already. I can't wait to make these again.

Love this recipe! I’m NOT a cook an these turned out great! I did make a few changes.... my daughter is celiac so I crushed up some GF crackers instead of the breadcrumbs. I reduced the amount of oregano (I’m not too fond of oregano lol), and I didn’t have any red pepper flakes so I put in a little cayenne pepper. Awesome! I’ll definitely be making these again
Delicious! I used oats instead of the bread crumbs. I was weary because I don't like the taste of ground turkey. The spices hide the taste.
amazing! Added 1/2 lb sweet Italian sausage.
These were great! Very moist! I omitted the tomato sauce because I sautéed them in olive oil. Then added tomato sauce and let them simmer cooked through. I will definitely make these again!
I used marinara sauce in the meatballs browned them in a skillet and added marinara..very tasty
Easy to make and very tasty, even for my pickiest eaters. I will definitely make it again. Also I used dried herbs since that is all I had on hand.
Best ever!!,,,,,
I rated this 3 stars because the liquid was too little, I even doubled it up but still too dry. Next time, I would add an egg. The seasonings were a little overwhelming.

My family loved these! I feed a crowd so I doubled the recipe, added a package of Sweet Italian Sausage and also used sprouted bread crumbs for a healthier carb option. I also added a 15 oz. can of diced tomatoes without draining. The seasoning was wonderful as called for, but I did improvise and use dried herbs and cut back to 1/3 of what was called for when using fresh. I will definitely be making these again!

This will be my 4th time making these delicious meatballs. They're just wonderful and my 5 year old loves them.

I made the recipe almost exactly like written, save the mustard because I didn't have any. 

Still, these are great.
Sooooooo good with a pepper gravy

These are now the preferred meatballs in our house. They freeze well, so you can make a lot and pull out some as needed. I omitted the red pepper flakes because one of us doesn't like things that are too spicy. Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly. I've made them several times now, and will certainly make them again.
These are delicious. The first turkey meatballs that my husband didn’t roll his eyes at. I will be making these again and again.
Delicious!

This is a great recipe! I used 2 pounds of lean turkey breast and adjusted the rest of the ingredients accordingly. I didn’t have Rosemary (dried or fresh) so I omitted that and added dried basil and they were still delicious. We love spice but still thought the crushed red pepper should have been cut in half. I let these meatballs simmer in organic pasta sauce and we ate it for three days straight! Flavorful low fat dinner.

I Mixed Turkey Sausage with the Ground Turkey!
Flavor was amazing. Brushed melted Ghee on 
meatballs to bake. Browned nicely!
Great flavor. Next time I will reduce the length of time baking.
Made per directions, used fresh herbs...excellent flavor!
We loved it!
Very easy to make, delicious!
Very good! Made cocktail meatball sauce to go with.
Love the recipe. Didn't do the "Melt". Turned on broiler for ~ 3 minutes at the end. Family enjoyed them!
These came out great! I used a combination of feta and Parmesan; mostly feta. I paired them with whole wheat spaghetti, off-the-shelf light Alfredo, and some canned Italian style diced tomatoes.

I work as a Caregiver. My patient loves ground turkey and also loves Italian food. I'm also Italian, so I made these for her. She LOVED them!! They are a win-win. I didn't have the dry mustard, so I made these w/out that one ingredient. The Parsley, oregano, and rosemary was also dried, not fresh, so I used 1/2 the amount. Still came out delicious and tasty!!
The flavoring is great and really spices up the ground turkey.
omgosh good!!

These are incredible. I couldn't believe how tasty they were. I have now made them twice. Followed the recipe (tomato sauce I only had ketchup). First time, I made them for a pasta dish. The second time, we had friends over and I made them as an appetizer. They were delicious straight out of the oven and disappeared very quickly ! I put out different sauces with them. Will definitely be making these again. Thank you.
Just finished eating one, delicious and healthy
I used smoked turkey and added 1 lb. Sage sausage. 2 eggs and about a 1!4 traspoon crushed Fennel. They were awesome.
made these with all dry ingredients adjusted accordingly. forgot the parmesan and they still turned out absolutely delicious (and moist which tends to be an issue with poultry).
Delicious! Flavorful. My husband and I loved them. Not dry and very tasty. I only had ground chicken and it was fine next time I’ll try with ground turkey

Loved these! I tried to follow as closely as possible with what I had on hand. No tomato sauce, but I did have fresh tomatoes that I let simmer and puréed into a sauce. The only fresh herb I had was parsley, so I used that, but for the rest I used the same amount that was called for, just dried versions. Didn’t have Italian breadcrumbs so I used regular breadcrumbs and threw some Italian seasoning on top. I have no idea what Melt is, so I didn’t use it. I put some foil down on a cookie sheet, sprayed it with cooking spray, and cooked for 20 minutes. They were so good! I had 1 pound of ground turkey and made 21 meatballs. Definitely making again!

Healthier alternative to beef - less fat. Very tasty and reminded me of italian sausage. I used a few squirts of mustard instead of dried mustard and substituted store-bought spaghetti sauce for tomato sauce, then served with the remaining sauce over the meatballs and spaghetti. Delicious and quick to prepare. I will be making this again!
Loved the flavor and will make them again!
I had been searching for a great meatball my grandson would enjoy and they family liked. This was a hit all around. I’ll definitely make it again!

Turned out great! I used panko bread crumbs because that’s what I had onhand, and increased the salt a little. Definitely use the 93% ground turkey and not the 99% fat free turkey. Otherwise they will turn out very dry.
These were tasty! I seared them in a skillet and then put in a slow cooker and they turned out moist and had good flavor. I used a jar of turkey gravy instead of the tomato sauce. Will make again.

Great! Lots of flavor by accident. I used one pound of turkey. This will be a new favorite! And, I didn’t have Parmesan. I also made QUICK SPAGHETTI SAUCE BY JON that is perfect and simple from our frozen summer tomatoes. Love, love, love it!

These were delicious and pretty easy to make. I slightly tweaked the recipe to my taste - I used stale hot dog buns for the breadcrumbs because that's all I had! My family loved them, flavorful and moist.
I added some spicy sausage to the recipe. They turned out great.
These were very tasty, but I thought there was too much oregano. I will cut it to 1 Tablespoon the next time, then see how that tastes. I do recommend this recipe.
I have made these three times and each time they have turned out excellent. They are exceptional. They taste like a high calorie meatball ....imagine that...they're not!!!
Very delicious! loved that you could cook these in the oven and did not have to fry them! I made these for company and they were all eaten!
I put more tomato sauce (about a half cup) to make them more moist. Excellent - my family loves them and you can’t tell they’re made with turkey meat.
These were great!

This was my first time making anything with Ground Turkey. They were delicious. Will definitely be making again. Instead of putting them on a broiler pan I cooked them on a sheet pan lined with aluminum foil for easy clean up and a cooling rack so I didn’t have to turn them.

I’ve made these several times. I typically use two pounds of meat and just increase seasonings a bit. I use dried herbs and fresh grated Parmesan cheese. They taste pretty great with dried herbs in my opinion, and it’s just easier overall.

Really liked these. I didn’t use quite as much parsley and would cut down on the red pepper flakes next time. A little spicy. I dropped the bills into simmering pasta sauce.babd simmer for an hour orbso. That way they stay nice and round and the sauce is absorbed some. Will make again.

Excellent!! I did have to make some minor changes based on what I had on hand and some other reviewers suggestions. I only had 1lb ground turkey, but I also had 1/2 lb chicken sausage and mixed that in. For the herbs I did 1/2 tsp dried oregano, 3/4 tsp dried rosemary, 1.5 Tbsp fresh basil as well as the 1/3c fresh parsely. Added 3 Tbsp finely chopped yellow onions, and substituted the crushed pepper for black pepper. I used a marinara sauce instead of tomato sauce and grated Parmesan instead of shredded. For the bread crumbs I used half plain and half seasoned as I thought the chicken sausage would already have enough extra seasoning. Used my cookie scoop to make 35 meatballs. Baked at 385* for 30 minutes. Perfect!! Everyone loved them! Thanks for the recipe!!!
These came out fabulous! Only made minor adjustments. Left out the butter spread and the tomato sauce, but put in 1/8 cup of olive oil. Used fresh herbs and added some basil. They were fabulous!!

After reading many of the reviews I made several of the same
changes. This is a very easy and really tasty recipe.
Just reduce the parsley & oregano, and use a Tbsp. melted butter. I used the italian bread crumbs.
